text: The Rhythmic Songs Chart is a monitored airplay chart in Billboard Magazine. The chart tracks the 40 most popular singles being played on 68 monitored rhythmic radio stations in the United States.Chart Legend from Billboard Arbitron sometimes calls it rhythmic contemporary hit radio The chart was introduced on October 3, 1992, with "End of The Road" by Boyz II Men as the first number-one single. ==References== ==Other websites== *Current BDS Rhythmic Top 40 chart (updated weekly) Category:Billboard charts
title: Rhythmic Songs Chart
